page.title: 07HOSPITAL LIFE - ERSKINE
page.content:
On Thursday 14th June six pupils of our class {interviewed}a patient who told us that he had been{a physical {training instructor}in the{R.A.F.}Now he is{paralysed}and spends most of his time in a{wheelchair.
On good days he likes to wheel himself around the{magnificent grounds}of the hospital estate. In the afternoons he enjoys the{entertainment}in the{Games {Room.}Sometimes a singer will come to conduct{community singing;there may be a game of{Bingo}or{Darts}or{Cards;}or he may prefer to sit and{chat}with the special friends he has made in the hospital.
The{good food;}the{excellent care and {attention}from the staff made him feel that he was living in a{first class {hotel}and not in a hospital.
